title: Food Inspection Violations

groups.description: Local Government Topic - for all datasets with state, local, county organizations
groups.title: Local Government
groups.name: local

name: food-inspection-violations
notes:
The Wake County health department inspects food service facilitiesnthroughout Wake County. The department permits and inspects these facilities,nand responds to citizen complaints. In the event of disease outbreak, thendepartment investigates to determine the source of the infection, and preventnfurther illness.nn

This dataset captures the restaurants that areninspected.u00a0 The data set is geocodednbased on address with approximately 85% of the locations having a validngeo-location.u00a0

nn

You can find out additional information about our restaurantninspections on our website:u00a0

>Food Safety and Sanitation

nn

This table captures all Wake County sanitationninspections from September 20, 2012 to Present.

nn

This table is part of a set of data that combined will givenyou a picture of all restaurant inspections.u00a0nThose three tables are:

nn

1.u00a0u00a0u00a0u00a0 Restaurants:nThis table captures all active facilitiesnwhere Wake County performs sanitations inspections.u00a0 Facilities that are closed are removed fromnall three files in this dataset.u00a0 Per NCnState regulations, facilities that have a change in ownership are considerednclosed and the restaurant re-opens under a new permit, even if there is not a changenin the name of the restaurant.

nn

2.u00a0u00a0u00a0u00a0 Food Inspections:nThis table captures all Wake Countynperforms sanitations inspections at active restaurants since September 20, 2012

nn

3.u00a0u00a0u00a0u00a0 Food Inspection Violations:nThis table captures all violationsnidentified during specific Wake County sanitations inspections at activenrestaurants since September 20, 2012.u00a0 Itnreports the results in code violations and according to CDC Risk Factors.u00a0 You can find additional informationnabout the CDC Risk Factors on the FDA website:

>Retail Risk FactornStudy

nn

u00a0

nn

The tables can be connected through the HSISIDnfield and the Permit ID field.u00a0

nnnn

The frequency of facility inspections fall undernthe following rules:

nn

Inspected once per year:

nn

Risk Category I applies to food servicenestablishments that prepare only non-potentially hazardous foods.

Inspected twice per year:

nn

Risk Category II applies to food servicenestablishments that cook and cool no more than two potentially hazardous foods.nPotentially hazardous raw ingredients shall be received in a ready-to-cooknform.

Inspected three times per year

nn

Risk Category III applies to food servicenestablishments that cook and cool no more than three potentially hazardousnfoods.

Inspected four times per year

nn

Risk Category IV applies tonfood service establishments that cook and cool an unlimited number ofnpotentially hazardous foods. This category also includes those facilities usingnspecialized processes or serving a highly susceptible population.
